title: Normal Distribution: What Percentile Does Your Car Fall In?
question_text:
The weight of a particular type of car follows a normal distribution with a mean weight of $2970\text{ pounds}$ and a standard deviation of $840\text{ pounds}$.
About thirty-two percent of cars of this type weigh below what value?
solution:
Using process of elimination, we can eliminate Choices 'D' and 'E' as we are looking for the cutoff for the bottom $32\%$. The mean represents $50\%$ in a normal distribution which indicates the weight of the car in the $32$ percentile is below $2970\text{ pounds}$.

When we run this in our calculator, we get $\bf 2577.2\text{ pounds}$

Choice 'C' is our answer.

Alternative Method

A second approach to solving this would be to use the z-score formula: If $x$ is an observation from a normal distribution with a known mean and standard deviation, the z-score of $x$ is

$$z=\dfrac { \text{x-mean }}{ \text{standard deviation} }$$

Now we need to find the z-score for $32\%$ either using Table A or a graphing calculator.
